quest.name: Like Master, Like Pupil
journal: The trace of a wry smile is visible on Y'shtola's lips.

In your quest to cure as many of the tempered as possible, it is decided that you will turn to the wisdom of Master Matoya, the realm's foremost authority on familiars. Wasting no time, you set out for the Archon's hidden refuge in the Dravanian hinterlands.

Stepping into the dimly lit cave, you are greeted by the perennially cantankerous Matoya in typically biting fashion. “Pleasantries” thus exchanged, she demands to know your reason for coming, and Y'shtola dutifully explains your need for more familiars to play the role of Angelo. Pondering the challenge of producing a veritable herd of the creatures, the elderly Archon proposes creating a mother porxie who would in turn create the necessary porxies, and with a mixture of nostalgia and annoyance, makes mention of a certain moldy old hole...

The place to which Matoya so fondly alluded is soon revealed to be her abandoned workshop in the Makers' Quarter. There, she declares, you will be able to obtain all of the necessary ingredients for the mother porxie, and put them to use. You duly set off for the workshop's entrance, where a poroggo guide awaits.

At your word, the poroggo named Puro Roggo will show you into Matoya's Relict, that you might set about making your familiar-making familiar.

※To enlist your companion NPCs for this duty, speak with them near the entrance or access Duty Support via the main menu. Use the Duty Finder if you wish to complete the instance alongside fellow players.
At the end of your ramble through the relict, you succeed in creating─and subsequently taming─the mother porxie. All that remains is to see if she can produce a litter of little helpers.

After G'raha Tia imbues the mother porxie with his magick, Y'shtola provides the familiar with the energy she needs to give birth. And give birth she does, to three bouncing baby Angelos, as all look on approvingly.

Your task in the relict thus accomplished, you rejoin your comrades outside. Though it will still be hard work to create the porxies, the process has been made a great deal more manageable, bringing you another step closer to finding a lasting solution to the primal problem.
objectives: Speak with Y'shtola in the Ruling Quarter.
Speak with Puro Roggo in the Makers' Quarter.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You may recall that in order to procure the ingredients for Angelo, we had no choice but to surrender ourselves to the whims of the pixies. But I should have done so with far better grace had I known what we would go on to achieve.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We did it. We brought Ga Bu back. And if I have any say in the matter, he'll be the first of many.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Alisaie will be exhausted from her efforts, but you wouldn't think so to look at her now. If she is ready to press on, then so am I.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As she will be at pains to remind me, I have not paid Master Matoya a visit since returning from the First. But this seems as good a time as any. Come, let us make for her cave.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It has been some time since Master Matoya last saw Y'shtola. What a lot they will have to talk about.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Do you remember? When last we came here, it was to find out why the others had collapsed. If someone had told me then that they'd been whisked away to another world, I would probably have laughed in their face. You live and learn, eh?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Master Matoya is something of a legend among Archons. I very much look forward to meeting her...if not the dressing down I am liable to receive for my inept attempts at summoning you.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I take it you are ready to bear witness to the joyous reunion of master and pupil? Very well...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: A porxie that produces porxies... What an inspired idea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...By the way, Forename. Do you think I misspoke earlier? I assure you it was not my intention to embarrass anyone.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: In case you've ever wondered, Alphinaud got his innocent streak from our mother. And it can be rather endearing─even useful in certain situations.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But most of the time, it just makes me want to shake him. Poor Y'shtola...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Moldy old hole”...? She really must miss the place.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Where does she mean, do you think? Some manner of hidden workshop, perhaps?

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: All right, off to my old workshop, then. Everything required to make your familiar is there.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That may be, but no one has set foot in there since the exodus. I dread to imagine what has become of it.

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: Oh, there's sure to be a handful of feral familiars and mayhap a monster or two. But nothing to trouble the likes of you. You can consider cleaning up the place payment for my help.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Fine. We'll do it.

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: Good girl. Now, if there are no other objections, I suggest you run along to the Makers' Quarter.

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: I'll send one of my poroggos ahead to let you into the workshop. You need only tell him who you are. One can't be too careful, after all. Off you go.

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: What are you still doing here? Off to the Makers' Quarter with you! I'll join you when I'm ready. Go on, now! Shoo!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As I may have mentioned, Alisaie and I were still very young when we departed with the exodus. I envy Y'shtola for remembering the city as it once was.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The grass could certainly do with a trim...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The workshop was an unforgiving place even before the exodus, and I doubt the years of neglect have improved it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Judging by the unruly state of the flora without, I think it safe to assume there will be no shortage of unruly fauna within. Add to that the undisturbed secrets of the workshop, and we have the makings of an adventure!

dialogue.name: GUIDEPOROGGO
dialogue.text: Greetings, ribbit, and welcome to my good mistress's relict. Puro Roggo is my name, and I am honored to be your guide.

dialogue.name: GUIDEPOROGGO
dialogue.text: Within you will find a space dedicated to the making of familiars, along with a cavern wherein the requisite ingredients may be had. I must warn you, however, that the place has not played host to a single soul, much less a broom, in over fifteen years, and will, I regret, be in some disarray.

dialogue.name: GUIDEPOROGGO
dialogue.text: But rest assured, my brothers and I shall see to it you do not lose your way. Now then, ribbit! Only say the word, and I will show you in.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Small talk.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Form a party and enter Matoya's Relict.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though it has been a while since last I joined the fray, I have followed Alisaie's example and practiced whenever possible. My healing magicks are ready as always.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'm no stranger to porxie-making, as you know. And that must count for something!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I was still a child when last I came here, but now I am rather more capable. Not that Master Matoya seems to have noticed. Mayhap she will when I have cleaned up the mess she left.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So, Forename, shall I lead the van? Or would you rather I followed up the rear?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Whatever you prefer, I am happy to adapt. So come, let us go and make our mother porxie!

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: Why aren't you in the Makers' Quarter? You're to look for my poroggo there. Go on now. I'll join you when I'm good and ready.

dialogue.name: GUIDEPOROGGO
dialogue.text: Are you ready, ribbit? But give me the word, and I will show you in.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Given it was her first time making a porxie, Master Matoya did a fine job. Though she did have Angelo for inspiration.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forgive me if this is a silly question, but of all creatures real and imagined...why choose a flying pig? Not that I dislike pigs, mind you...

dialogue.name: MATOYA
dialogue.text: Ugh, my joints were fairly screaming by the time I got home, and Shtola was more hindrance than help. In future, I'll thank you to keep your favors closer to my cave.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I will rest here awhile. Go on without me.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, Master Matoya has returned to her cave with Y'shtola. Hm hm! They are as peas in a pod, are they not?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now enter Matoya's Relict with a party of NPC avatars. To make use of this feature, open the Trust interface located under Duty in the main menu.
